title: U.S. Junk Bonds Hold Steady Through Ukraine Invasion
sub_head: High-yield debt markets mostly hold their ground after Russia’s incursion into Ukraine
body:
U.S. high-yield debt markets held largely steady in the face of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, although some junk-rated bond and loan deals have been pulled in the face of market uncertainty.
The S&P U.S. High Yield Corporate Bond Index was down 0.53% on Thursday, according to data compiled by S&P, as U.S. stocks fluctuated widely and some investors piled into riskier assets amid a changing interest-rate outlook.
